block.p: Elizabeth Cranston Baxter, the daughter of Mrs. Douglas E. Baxter of Bethany Beach, Del., and the late Mr. Baxter, was married yesterday to Arthur Crosswell Butcher, a son of Mr. and Mrs. McBee Butcher of Radnor, Pa. Canon P. Simon Mein performed the Episcopal ceremony at St. Andrew's School, a boarding school in Middletown, Del., from which the bride and bridegroom graduated.

Mr. and Mrs. Butcher work in Boston, where she is the director of business development for the LendingTree, a loan marketing company on the Internet, and he is the Northeast sales manager for the urology unit of Boston Scientific, a maker of medical devices.

Elizabeth Cranston Baxter, the daughter of Mrs. Douglas E. Baxter of Bethany Beach, Del., and the late Mr. Baxter, was married yesterday to Arthur Crosswell Butcher, a son of Mr. and Mrs. McBee Butcher of Radnor, Pa. Canon P. Simon Mein performed the Episcopal ceremony at St. Andrew's School, a boarding school in Middletown, Del., from which the bride and bridegroom graduated.

Mr. and Mrs. Butcher work in Boston, where she is the director of business development for the LendingTree, a loan marketing company on the Internet, and he is the Northeast sales manager for the urology unit of Boston Scientific, a maker of medical devices.

The bride graduated from Mount Holyoke College and received an M.B.A. from Columbia University. Her father was a vice president and the director of the special creative service group at N. W. Ayer & Son, the New York advertising agency.

The bridegroom graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. His father, who is retired from Wheat First Butcher & Singer, an investment bank, was the chairman of Butcher & Singer, its Philadelphia-based subsidiary.
